definition: novice/new hand/sb new to a job
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: We ( continuo ) continue our (Foreign) Students (serious) Series this week with a reporter on the International Student Handbook.
sentences.chinese: 我们这继续外国学生系列关于国际学生手册的报告。

sentences.english: Though Sue is a green hand, she's completely at grips with the details of her job.
sentences.chinese: 休虽然是生手，但她完全了解她工作的细节。

sentences.english: He was warned not to hire any more greenhorns as clerks.
sentences.chinese: 有人提醒他别再雇佣生手当职员了。

sentences.english: The student handbook says that students will face disciplinary action if caught.
sentences.chinese: 学生手册称被抓到的学生将会面临纪律处分。

sentences.english: I'm usually green at the job.
sentences.chinese: 对这项任务来说我仍然是个生手。

sentences.english: The restrictions, rules and regulations of all kinds can usually be found in your student's handbook.
sentences.chinese: 学校的规章制度都写在你的学生手册里面。

sentences.english: As a greenhorn , he needs our help.
sentences.chinese: 他是生手，需要我们的帮助。

sentences.english: I am a greenhorn in this field.
Maiko (literally "dance girl") are apprentice geisha, and this stage can last for years.
sentences.chinese: 舞妓是艺妓生手，这个过程可能会持续很多年。

sentences.english: Like to wait for a dozen raw opened that way?
sentences.chinese: 愿意等待十来个生手来这么做么？

sentences.english: I'm a bit green at video editing, so it takes me a long time to edit things.
sentences.chinese: 编辑视频我是生手，那花去了我很长时间去编辑。

sentences.english: You and I are both green hands.
Printing student Handbooks in both Chinese and English versions.

sentences.chinese: 这个生手的眼睛都亮了。

sentences.english: He is young at the work.
sentences.chinese: 他对那项工作是个生手。

definition: experienced person/an old hand at sth
newly hatched bird/fig. inexperienced person/fig. chick (slighting term for young woman)/bimbo
lit. an easy drive on a familiar path (idiom); fig. experience makes progress easy/a task that is so familiar one can do it with one's hand tied behind one's back
switch to a job one was not trained for
carelessly and haphazardly/to paw/to grope/to get fresh
lit. doesn't (even) enter a single aperture (of one's head)/I don't understand a word (idiom)/it's all Greek to me
to have a skill/to have a lot on the ball/to have an affair
